actions.message: hi all
Hi all!
Hi
The key thing is to judge whether to withhold to buy an extra permanent train
I got greedy this afternoon and bought 3 3Ts. It didn't work out in my favor
This will be my first...
No, buy fast but never three of any non-perm train
If I had gotten a second company, it would have been fine. But I didn't, and it wasn't
you can't hit ATL twice
btw
To select a route to Atlanta, select the hex containing atlanta, not the converging track
you can only hit it once, though, right?
right, once per RR per OR
I missed that. Thanks.
I'm only buying 2!!
Atta boy!
So, what is the point of the three exits to Atlanta if only one can be used per OR?
It was to use the existing track on the 18Dixie map without having to make special green and brown tiles for Montgomery.
ahhh
This game was originally an extra game that came with 18Dixie
About how long did your game take this afternoon?
Under an hour
wow, that's fast play. I wanted this to be a short game that still feels like a whole game...
I think 60-90 minutes feels right for most groups.
(or at least most groups I'd want to play with)
As often as not, the player with only one RR wins in 3 player games. You have to finagle to get extra trains to beat that is what I've found....
you better token Birmingham, WRA. I'm ok if you want to go back
Don't tempt me, LOL
Definitely a different game. I'm having a little trouble wrapping my head around it, in a good way. Thanks.
Another kind of weird thing is that brown tiles are not available until a 6Train goes, even though 5Trains are permanent....

Do you feel that 2Ts are pretty terrible in this game? The get 2 fewer runs than a 3T purchased late in OR1.1, and set you up for early permanent trains, which it feels like are things you don't really want.
Could be the rebate helps offset that
GMO seems like an early powerhouse, or is it better balanced than I realize?
Permanent trains don't get to skip dits, so I'm having to tunnel around all these things for a late game run
Ah
It can be difficult for the GMO to get decent runs with a 5T or 6T
It can run two 2Ts and a 3T between NO and Tallahassee for a ton early
don't forget you can pitch in cash for your train
Yes, but I didn't have enough cash
that is a problem, then
The timing is very important. Sometimes you don't spend all your money in a SR so you will have enough to contribute in OR x.1
Something to remember to watch
Can't quite make it this time for the extra train, but I will try anyway.
sorry
np
that has a permanent train in it! lol
Yeah, but I could see you switching it over. I am possibly over concerned about getting dumped on, but there it is.
I think there just aren't enough shares to buy in this game for dumping to be a thing, but I'm sure it could be in the right scenario.
I suspect that is a "meta" question more than an overall strategy question
My regular group, I would be much less concerned
this might be one of those games where a dump mutually hurts both players involved

I think I will let you have the IC, though you are right. You don't usually dump companies because there aren't enough shares to buy. I am too short on cash so I will try it. I always try different things so it may work out for you...
Never mind the losses by BK in 18Ch and the like, I actually came in 3rd on a 46 game because of dumping
Joy :D
It just isn't going to work, shouldn't have contributed for the extra train back there.
although you can take it if you want it
No. I hadn't considered a dump in this SR, but I guess it would be silly to worry about it now.
Getting a company with two 4+ trains is not a bad thing. Withhold once and contribute for a permanent train and you are fine
Another reason to hold where I am, but not worry about it, I think
I don't know why you were all scared of buying GMO shares
Or you can pay out twice, collect the salvage for the 2 4+ trains and then either buy over or emergency Money raise after the next SR
Oh, there's a typo in the log\
^^ It says I pitched in cash for a 2D, and then that I bought a 4D
Said it for me, too
looks like you have a 4D
Yeah, but I got confused when I looked at the log
"TIE53 pays $261 and an additional $50 fee to assist buying a 2D train"
You shouldn't have had to contribute for a 2D as I am pretty sure GMO had more than $500 during its turn
right. I wanted the 4D
the dialog was just wrong. It gave me the train I wanted
I see
Same for me. The one line in the log is wrong, but I did get the right train.
In the physical game, the 2D/4D trains will be on different sides and the purchaser chooses when they buy the train
yeah, it's probably just a variable/concatenation issue. It should be easy for them to fix
I was just thinking that. For the "assisted buy", it probably doesn't distinguish which side of the card you chose.
Does it matter?
It matters to prevent further confusion for people who think they bought a 2D by accident!
Just a dialog problem I guess, hadn't noticed it. Of course in the physical game, the 2D/4D trains are on different sides, just like in 18Dixie though the prices have been changed...
I suppose. Probably easier to change the label for that line from "2D" to "2D/4D" than to make it show the right train every time.
Mark, are you still running, or are we out of sync?
man I've really screwed this up with the L&N. Gonna be pitiful income this OR at least
$320 is pitiful?
For a 5 and a 6, maybe. It looks like it ran as two 4Ts
Thought it would only be $280. You can sometimes get some scary income with multiple trains, like what GMO is going to run for next OR...
I think I'm only running by 4+ as a 2T, though
I'll need to check something when we are through, there may be a problem with the tile mix.
I have the rules up, what do you think is missing?
The dot town tiles don't seem right. I have a super secret pre-production prototype Scott sent me.
the rules say 3 of each yellow and 2 of each green
yep, that's right. Tried to keep the tile mix a little tight to limit it to about 90 tiles total.  It was supposed to help keep the cost down.
While there are obviously some nasty things that can be done, in many ways, I think this is the kinder, gentler 18xx I also want to play sometimes.
And I love the play time
I think you have to kind of look ahead and try to see who is going to be the best company just like in most 18xx games. I knew I couldn't afford to contribute a few ORs ago but did it anyway....
Yeah, I started planning for my 4D on OR1.2
Akado is fond of saying that having the best corp and $10 gets you lunch, but this one, it seems like the best corp is a useful primary goal.
D'oh! out of 2D/4D trains!
when you can own 70% of your company, it's even better
haha oops.  5d?
doesn't feel right to contribute with it split 4-3-3
you can run a 6T pretty well
yeah it has a decent 6 run
I feel like being able to pitch in cash for your trains also encourages players to get all their tokens down
It probably would have been better for L&N to buy over the 2D for all of its money and let the IC back up then buy the 5D. L&N would have run once for even more
gg all thanks for playing
GG all. Thanks for letting me get an intro to this very cool 18xx title.
congrats TIE53
It's good to try this again against different humans with the last few tweaks
It should play online pretty fast once folks get used to it
Yeah, before today I had only played it once, with Scott, and that was when it was in super early development
The trains are the really tricky part. Tried to make something that wouldn't be so intimidating length-wise for new players but still felt like a whole game.
It was amazing how different it plays compared to version one that still comes with 18Dixie
Yeah.  I'm sure I can get a lot of my eurogaming friends to play this who like heavy games but don't like "long" games
It is pretty different in some ways than a typical 18xx game but it should work in showing the basic concepts like routes, tile laying etc.
I do worry that those who have played version 1 will be confused with the changes but maybe there aren't that many folks who bought the earlier edition.
Anyway, congrats and we'll talk to you later...
